more_info.origin:
/strong>
Natural polysaccharide, produced by different seaweeds of the family Phaeophyceae (Macrocystis pyrifera, Laminaria digitata, L. cloustoni, Ascophyllum nodosum) in the USA and the UK.
more_info.side_effects:
/strong>
None known in the concentrations used. High concentrations lead to impairment of iron uptake, as the iron is bound.
more_info.dietary_restrictions:
/strong>
Alginic acid and alginates can be used by all religious groups, vegans and vegetarians.

more_info.origin:
/strong>
Sodium salt of alginic acid (E400), a natural polysaccharide, produced by different seaweeds of the family Phaeophyceae (Macrocystis pyrifera, Laminaria digitata, L. cloustoni, Ascophyllum nodosum) in the USA and the UK.
more_info.side_effects:
/strong>
None known in the concentrations used. High concentrations lead to impairment of iron uptake, as the iron is bound.
more_info.dietary_restrictions:
/strong>
Alginic acid and alginates can be used by all religious groups, vegans and vegetarians.

more_info.origin:
/strong>
Potassium salt of alginic acid (), a natural polysaccharide, produced by different seaweeds of the family Phaeophyceae (Macrocystis pyrifera, Laminaria digitata, L. cloustoni, Ascophyllum nodosum) in the USA and the UK.
more_info.products: br/>Many different products, mainly for low-salt/sodium products.
more_info.side_effects:
/strong>
None known in the concentrations used. High concentrations lead to impairment of iron uptake, as the iron is bound.
more_info.dietary_restrictions:
/strong>
Alginic acid and alginates can be used by all religious groups, vegans and vegetarians.

more_info.origin:
/strong>
Ammonium salt of alginic acid (E400), a natural polysaccharide, produced by different seaweeds of the family Phaeophyceae (Macrocystis pyrifera, Laminaria digitata, L. cloustoni, Ascophyllum nodosum) in the USA and the UK.
more_info.products: br/>Soft drinks, food colours, icings, etc.
more_info.side_effects:
/strong>
None known in the concentrations used. High concentrations lead to impairment of iron uptake, as the iron is bound.
more_info.dietary_restrictions:
/strong>
Alginic acid and alginates can be used by all religious groups, vegans and vegetarians.

more_info.origin:
/strong>
Calcium salt of alginic acid (E400), a natural polysaccharide, produced by different seaweeds of the family Phaeophyceae (Macrocystis pyrifera, Laminaria digitata, L. cloustoni, Ascophyllum nodosum) in the USA and the UK.
more_info.characteristics: br/>Thickening agent, emulsifier, prevents crystallisation in frozen products.
more_info.products: br/>Ice cream and frozen bakery products.
more_info.side_effects:
/strong>
None known in the concentrations used. High concentrations lead to impairment of iron uptake, as the iron is bound.
more_info.dietary_restrictions:
/strong>
Alginic acid and alginates can be used by all religious groups, vegans and vegetarians.

more_info.origin:
/strong>
Propylene glycol ester of alginic acid (), a natural polysaccharide, produced by different seaweeds of the family Phaeophyceae (Macrocystis pyrifera, Laminaria digitata, L. cloustoni, Ascophyllum nodosum) in the USA and the UK.
more_info.side_effects:
/strong>
None known in the concentrations used, although some people exhibit adverse reactions towards high concentrations of propylene glycol.
more_info.dietary_restrictions:
/strong>
Alginic acid and alginates can be used by all religious groups, vegans and vegetarians.

more_info.origin:
/strong>
A natural polysaccharide, produced by different seaweeds of the family Rhodophyceae (Gelidium amansii, G. cartilagineum) in the USA and Japan.
more_info.side_effects:
/strong>
None known in the concentrations used, although high concentrations bring about flatulence and bloating, due to fermentation by the intestinal microflora (in the same way as all indigestible polysaccharides).
more_info.dietary_restrictions:
/strong>
Agar can be used by all religious groups, vegans and vegetarians.

more_info.origin:
/strong>
A natural polysaccharide, produced by different seaweeds (Chrondrus crispus, Gigartina stellata, Euchema spinosum, E. cottonii) in Europe, Asia and America. It is a complex mixture of polysaccharides. E407a has a slightly different composition; moreover, it contains a considerable amount of cellulose.
more_info.side_effects:
/strong>
None known in the concentrations used, although high concentrations bring about flatulence and bloating, due to fermentation by the intestinal microflora (in the same way as all indigestible polysaccharides). Short-chain carrageenans may cause intestinal leakage and are not permitted for use in foods.
more_info.dietary_restrictions:
/strong>
Carrageenans can be used by all religious groups, vegans and vegetarians.

more_info.origin:
/strong>
A natural polysaccharide, produced from seaweed (Furcellaria fastigata) in Denmark. Sometimes it is placed under E407, due to the fact that they have similar chemical structures.
more_info.side_effects:
/strong>
None known in the concentrations used, although high concentrations bring about flatulence and bloating, due to fermentation by the intestinal microflora (in the same way as all indigestible polysaccharides).
more_info.dietary_restrictions:
/strong>
Furcelleran can be used by all religious groups, vegans and vegetarians.

more_info.origin:
/strong>
A natural polysaccharide, produced from the carob tree (Ceratonia siliqua) found mostly in the Mediterranean region.
more_info.side_effects:
/strong>
None known in the concentrations used, although high concentrations bring about flatulence and bloating, due to fermentation by the intestinal microflora (in the same way as all indigestible polysaccharides).
more_info.dietary_restrictions:
/strong>
Locust bean gum can be used by all religious groups, vegans and vegetarians.

more_info.origin:
/strong>
A natural polysaccharide, produced from oats .
more_info.side_effects:
/strong>
None known in the concentrations used, although high concentrations bring about flatulence and bloating, due to fermentation by the intestinal microflora (in the same way as all indigestible polysaccharides).
more_info.dietary_restrictions:
/strong>
Oat gum can be used by all religious groups, vegans and vegetarians.

more_info.origin:
/strong>
A natural polysaccharide, produced from the guar shrub (Cyamopsis tetragonolobus) found in Pakistan and India.
more_info.side_effects:
/strong>
None known in the concentrations used, although high concentrations bring about flatulence and bloating, due to fermentation by the intestinal microflora (in the same way as all indigestible polysaccharides).
more_info.dietary_restrictions:
/strong>
Guar gum can be used by all religious groups, vegans and vegetarians.

more_info.origin:
/strong>
A natural polysaccharide, produced from the tree Astralagus gummifer found in Iran, Syria and Turkey.
more_info.side_effects:
/strong>
None known in the concentrations used, although high concentrations bring about flatulence and bloating, due to fermentation by the intestinal microflora (in the same way as all indigestible polysaccharides).
more_info.dietary_restrictions:
/strong>
Gum tragacanth can be used by all religious groups, vegans and vegetarians.

more_info.origin:
/strong>
A natural polysaccharide, produced from the tree Acacia senegal from tropical Africa.
more_info.side_effects:
/strong>
None known in the concentrations used, although high concentrations bring about flatulence and bloating, due to fermentation by the intestinal microflora (in the same way as all indigestible polysaccharides).
more_info.dietary_restrictions:
/strong>
Gum arabic can be used by all religious groups, vegans and vegetarians.

more_info.origin:
/strong>
A natural polysaccharide, produced by the bacterium Xanthomonas campestris from sugar and molasses.
more_info.side_effects:
/strong>
None known in the concentrations used, although high concentrations bring about flatulence and bloating, due to fermentation by the intestinal microflora (in the same way as all indigestible polysaccharides).
more_info.dietary_restrictions:
/strong>
Xanthan gum can be used by all religious groups, vegans and vegetarians.

more_info.origin:
/strong>
A natural polysaccharide, obtained from the tree Sterculia urens found in India, as well as some related trees.
more_info.side_effects:
/strong>
None known in the concentrations used, although high concentrations bring about flatulence and bloating, due to fermentation by the intestinal microflora (in the same way as all indigestible polysaccharides). It has laxative properties.
more_info.dietary_restrictions:
/strong>
Karaya gum can be used by all religious groups, vegans and vegetarians.

more_info.origin:
/strong>
A natural polysaccharide (glactomannan), obtained from the tree Cesalpinia spinosa native to South America, but also cultivated in the Mediterranean region.
more_info.daily_intake: br/>None specified (temporary ADI was specified at 0,25 mg/kg body weight)
more_info.side_effects:
/strong>
None known in the concentrations used, although higher concentrations bring about flatulence and bloating, due to fermentation by the intestinal microflora (in the same way as all indigestible polysaccharides). It may have laxative properties. High concentrations can not be reached in foods due to the viscosity of the product.
more_info.dietary_restrictions:
/strong>
Tara gum can be used by all religious groups, vegans and vegetarians.

more_info.origin:
/strong>
A natural polysaccharide, produced by the bacterium Pseudomonas elodea from starch.
more_info.side_effects:
/strong>
None known in the concentrations used, although high concentrations bring about flatulence and bloating, due to fermentation by the intestinal microflora (in the same way as all indigestible polysaccharides). It has laxative properties.
more_info.dietary_restrictions:
/strong>
Gellan gum can be used by all religious groups, vegans and vegetarians.

more_info.origin:
/strong>
A natural carbohydrate alcohol, present in many berries and fruits, e.g., apples, prunes, cherries and grapes. It is commercially produced from glucose (dextrose).
more_info.characteristics: br/>Stabiliser, low-calorie sweetener, bulking agent, etc.
more_info.daily_intake: br/>There are no limits to the intake of E420; however, its use is not allowed for infants younger than 1 year of age, as it may cause severe diarrhoea.
more_info.side_effects:
/strong>
Sorbitol is partly absorbed and metabolised as fructose by the body; the remaining fraction is fermented in the large intestine. During fermentation, gases are produced, which may cause bloating and flatulence. In intolerant persons it can act as a laxative. There are normally no side effects in the concentrations used; however, some intolerant persons show gas formation at an intake as low as 5 grams of sorbitol. Side effects normally occur after an intake of 25-30 grams in a single dose, which is far above the usage in normal foods.
more_info.dietary_restrictions:
/strong>
Sorbitol can be used by all religious groups, vegans and vegetarians. The term carbohydrate alcohol is a chemical definition; sorbitol does not contain alcohol (ethanol).

more_info.origin:
/strong>
A natural carbohydrate alcohol, present in many plants, e.g., conifers, seaweed and mushrooms. It is commercially produced from glucose (dextrose).
more_info.characteristics: br/>Anti-caking agent, low-calorie sweetener, bulking agent, etc.
more_info.side_effects:
/strong>
Mannitol is largely absorbed and metabolised as glucose by the body. The remaining fraction is fermented in the large intestine. During fermentation, gases are produced, which may cause bloating and flatulence. In intolerant persons it can act as a laxative. Side effects normally occur after an intake of 25-30 grams in a single dose, which is far above the usage in normal foods.
more_info.dietary_restrictions:
/strong>
Mannitol can be used by all religious groups, vegans and vegetarians. The term carbohydrate alcohol is a chemical definition; mannitol does not contain alcohol (ethanol).

more_info.origin:
/strong>
A natural carbohydrate alcohol, which is one of the components of all fats. It is also present in low concentrations in blood. It is commercially produced either synthetically from propene, or by bacterial fermentation of sugars; it is not produced from fat.
more_info.characteristics: br/>Low-calorie sweetener, humectant (helps keep food moist), etc.
more_info.side_effects:
/strong>
Glycerol is absorbed and metabolised as glucose (by the body) into fats.
more_info.dietary_restrictions:
/strong>
Glycerol can be used by all religious groups, vegans and vegetarians. The term carbohydrate alcohol is a chemical definition; glycerol does not contain alcohol (ethanol).

more_info.origin:
/strong>
Synthetic compound, produced from ethylene oxide (a synthetic compound) and stearic acid (a natural fatty acid).
more_info.daily_intake: br/>Up to 25 mg/kg body weight for the entire group of compounds in the 430-E436 range; on the other hand, it has not been specified for the individual compounds.
more_info.side_effects:
/strong>
None known in the concentrations used. People intolerant of propylene glycol should also avoid the group of 430-E436.
more_info.dietary_restrictions:
/strong>
These compounds (430-E436) contain fatty acids, which are nearly always from vegetable oils; however, use of animal fat (including pork) cannot be fully ruled out. Chemically, the origin of these compounds cannot be determined; only the producer may provide information on the origin.

more_info.origin:
/strong>
E431 is a synthetic compound, produced from ethylene oxide (a synthetic compound) and stearic acid (a natural fatty acid).
more_info.daily_intake: br/>Up to 25 mg/kg body weight for the entire group of compounds in the 430-E436 range; on the other hand, it has not been specified for the individual compounds.
more_info.side_effects:
/strong>
None known in the concentrations used. People intolerant of propylene glycol should also avoid the group of 430-E436.
more_info.dietary_restrictions:
/strong>
These compounds (430-E436) contain fatty acids, which are nearly always from vegetable oils; however, use of animal fat (including pork) cannot be fully ruled out. Chemically, the origin of these compounds cannot be determined; only the producer may provide information on the origin.

more_info.origin:
/strong>
E432 is a synthetic compound, produced from ethylene oxide (a synthetic compound), sorbitol (see E420) and lauric acid (a natural fatty acid).
more_info.daily_intake: br/>Up to 25 mg/kg body weight for the entire group of compounds in the 430-E436 range; on the other hand, it has not been specified for the individual compounds.
more_info.side_effects:
/strong>
None known in the concentrations used. People intolerant of propylene glycol should also avoid the 430-E436 group.
more_info.dietary_restrictions:
/strong>
These compounds (430-E436) contain fatty acids, which are nearly always from vegetable oils; however, use of animal fat (including pork) cannot be fully ruled out. Chemically, the origin of these compounds cannot be determined; only the producer may provide information on the origin.

more_info.origin:
/strong>
E434 is a synthetic compound, produced from ethylene oxide (a synthetic compound), sorbitol (see E420) and palmitic acid (a natural fatty acid).
more_info.daily_intake: br/>Up to 25 mg/kg body weight for the entire group of compounds in the 430-E436 range; on the other hand, it has not been specified for the individual compounds.
more_info.side_effects:
/strong>
None known in the concentrations used. People intolerant of propylene glycol should also avoid the group of 430-E436
more_info.dietary_restrictions:
/strong>
These compounds (430-E436) contain fatty acids, which are nearly always from vegetable oils; however, use of animal fat (including pork) cannot be fully ruled out. Chemically, the origin of these compounds cannot be determined; only the producer may provide information on the origin.

more_info.origin:
/strong>
E435 is a synthetic compound, produced from ethylene oxide (a synthetic compound), sorbitol (see E420) and stearic acid (a natural fatty acid).
more_info.daily_intake: br/>Up to 25 mg/kg body weight for the entire group of compounds in the 430-E436 range; on the other hand, it has not been specified for the individual compounds.
more_info.side_effects:
/strong>
None known in the concentrations used. People intolerant of propylene glycol should also avoid the group of 430-E436.
more_info.dietary_restrictions:
/strong>
These compounds (430-E436) contain fatty acids, which are nearly always from vegetable oils; however, use of animal fat (including pork) cannot be fully ruled out. Chemically, the origin of these compounds cannot be determined; only the producer may provide information on the origin.

more_info.origin:
/strong>
E436 is a synthetic compound, produced from ethylene oxide (a synthetic compound), sorbitol (see E420) and stearic acid (a natural fatty acid).
more_info.daily_intake: br/>Up to 25 mg/kg body weight for the entire group of compounds in the 430-E436 range; on the other hand, it has not been specified for the individual compounds.
more_info.side_effects:
/strong>
None known in the concentrations used. People intolerant of propylene glycol should also avoid the group of 430-E436.
more_info.dietary_restrictions:
/strong>
These compounds (430-E436) contain fatty acids, which are nearly always from vegetable oils; however, use of animal fat (including pork) cannot be fully ruled out. Chemically, the origin of these compounds cannot be determined; only the producer may provide information on the origin.

more_info.origin:
/strong>
Pectin is a natural acid polysaccharide present in nearly all fruits, especially apples, quinces and oranges. It is commercially produced from apple pulp and orange peels. Sodium, potassium, and ammonium pectates are the respective salts of pectin. Amidated pectin is prepared by treating pectin with ammonia, after which amides are formed at the acid side chains.
more_info.products: br/>Marmalades, fruit jellies and sauces, and many other different products.
more_info.side_effects:
/strong>
Pectin acts as a thickening agent; thus, it may cause intestinal problems when present in high concentrations. As a result of its thickening effect, it is also used in diet preparations, where it reduces the feeling of hunger. It can be fermented in the large intestine, resulting in flatulence.
more_info.dietary_restrictions:
/strong>
None; pectin and pectates can be used by all religious groups, vegans and vegetarians.

more_info.origin: br/>Obtained from animal by-products, such as bones and hides. It can be produced from all species of animals.
more_info.side_effects:
/strong>
None known when used in foods
more_info.dietary_restrictions:
/strong>
441 can not be used by vegans and vegetarians. Use by religious groups, such as Muslims and Jews is restricted, due to the origin of the product. Unfortunately information on origin can only be obtained from the producer. Specific halal gelatin is made from cattle.

more_info.origin: br/>Obtained from ammonia and ph osphorylated fatty acids, mainly from rapeseed oil.
more_info.products: br/>Only used in chocolate and cocoa products
more_info.side_effects:
/strong>
None known when used in foods
more_info.dietary_restrictions:
/strong>
E442 is generally produced with rapeseed oil and can thus be consumed by all religious groups. However, the use of animal fat (incl. pork) can not be completed excluded.

more_info.origin: br/>Salts of sodium/potassium/calcium with phosphates. All are produced synthetically from the respective carbonates and phosphoric acid.
more_info.characteristics: br/>Buffers and emulsifiers. E450 (iii) also binds metals and prevents discoloration due to metals. E450 (vi) is also used as bread enhancer and calcium supplement.
more_info.daily_intake: br/>Up to 70 mg/kg bodyweight for all phosphate containing additives
more_info.side_effects:
/strong>
None known when used in foods. High concentrations of phosphates may disturb several metabolic processes as phosphate plays an important role in general metabolism.
more_info.dietary_restrictions:
/strong>
E450 can be consumed by all religious groups, vegans and vegetarians.

more_info.origin: br/>Salts of sodium/potassium with phosphates. All are produced synthetically from the respective carbonates and phosphoric acid.
more_info.characteristics: br/>Buffers, stabiliser and emulsifiers. Also used to retain water during processing.
more_info.daily_intake: br/>Up to 70 mg/kg bodyweight for all phosphate containing additives
more_info.side_effects:
/strong>
None known when used in foods. High concentrations of phosphates may disturb several metabolic processes as phosphate plays an important role in general metabolism.
more_info.dietary_restrictions:
/strong>
E451 can be consumed by all religious groups, vegans and vegetarians.

more_info.origin: br/>Salts of sodium/potassium/calcium/ammonium with phosphates. All are produced synthetically from the respective carbonates and phosphoric acid.
more_info.characteristics: br/>Sequestrants (metal binders), stabiliser and emulsifiers. Also used to retain water during processing and storage.
more_info.daily_intake: br/>Up to 70 mg/kg bodyweight for all phosphate containing additives
more_info.side_effects:
/strong>
None known when used in foods. High concentrations of phosphates may disturb several metabolic processes as phosphate plays an important role in general metabolism.
more_info.dietary_restrictions:
/strong>
E452 can be consumed by all religious groups, vegans and vegetarians.

more_info.origin: br/>Cellulose is the main polysaccharide and constituent of wood and all plant structures. Commercially prepared from wood.
more_info.characteristics: br/>Many different uses, mainly as thickening agent, but also as filler, dietary fibre, anti clumping agent and emulsfier.
more_info.side_effects:
/strong>
Cellulose is non soluble, but can be fermented in the large intestine. Large concentrations can cause intestinal problems, such as bloating, constipation and diarrhoea. Due to this fact it can not be used in weaning foods.
more_info.dietary_restrictions:
/strong>
E460 can be consumed by all religious groups, vegans and vegetarians.

more_info.origin:
/strong>
CMC is prepared from cellulose, the main polysaccharide and constituent of wood and all plant structures. Commercially prepared from wood and chemically methylated.
more_info.characteristics: br/>Many different uses, mainly as thickening agent, but also as filler, dietary fibre, anti clumping agent and emulsfier.
more_info.side_effects:
/strong>
Methylcellulose is practically non soluble, but can be fermented in the large intestine. Large concentrations can cause intestinal problems, such as bloating, constipation and diarrhoea.
more_info.dietary_restrictions:
/strong>
E461 can be consumed by all religious groups, vegans and vegetarians.

more_info.origin:
/strong>
Ethylcellulose is prepared from cellulose, the main polysaccharide and constituent of wood and all plant structures. Commercially prepared from wood and chemically ethylated.
more_info.characteristics: br/>Many different uses, mainly as thickening agent, but also as filler, dietary fibre, anti clumping agent and emulsfier.
more_info.products: br/>Few products, and no longer permitted as emulsifier in the EU.
more_info.side_effects:
/strong>
Ethylcellulose is practically non soluble, but can be fermented in the large intestine. Large concentrations can cause intestinal problems, such as bloating, constipation and diarrhoea.
more_info.dietary_restrictions:
/strong>
462 can be consumed by all religious groups, vegans and vegetarians.

more_info.origin:
/strong>
Hydroxypropylcellulose is prepared from cellulose, the main polysaccharide and constituent of wood and all plant structures. Commercially prepared from wood and chemically propylated.
more_info.characteristics: br/>Many different uses, mainly as thickening agent, but also as filler, dietary fibre, anti clumping agent and emulsfier. Similar as cellulose, but better soluble in water.
more_info.side_effects:
/strong>
Hydroxypropyl cellulose is quite soluble, and can be fermented in the large intestine. Large concentrations can cause intestinal problems, such as bloating, constipation and diarrhoea.
more_info.dietary_restrictions:
/strong>
E463 can be consumed by all religious groups, vegans and vegetarians.

more_info.origin:
/strong>
Hydroxypropylmethylcellulose is prepared from cellulose, the main polysaccharide and constituent of wood and all plant structures. Commercially prepared from wood and chemically modified.
more_info.characteristics: br/>Many different uses, mainly as thickening agent, but also as filler, dietary fibre, anti clumping agent and emulsfier. Similar as cellulose, but better soluble in water.
more_info.side_effects:
/strong>
Hydroxypropylmethyl cellulose is quite soluble, and can be fermented in the large intestine. Large concentrations can cause intestinal problems, such as bloating, constipation and diarrhoea.
more_info.dietary_restrictions:
/strong>
E464 can be consumed by all religious groups, vegans and vegetarians.

more_info.origin:
/strong>
Methylethylcellulose is prepared from cellulose, the main polysaccharide and constituent of wood and all plant structures. Commercially prepared from wood and chemically modified.
more_info.characteristics: br/>Many different uses, mainly as thickening agent, but also as filler, dietary fibre, anti clumping agent and emulsfier. Similar as cellulose, but with some different characteristics.
more_info.side_effects:
/strong>
Methylethyl cellulose is not very soluble, and can be fermented in the large intestine. Large concentrations can cause intestinal problems, such as bloating, constipation and diarrhoea.
more_info.dietary_restrictions:
/strong>
E465 can be consumed by all religious groups, vegans and vegetarians.

more_info.origin:
/strong>
Carboxymethylcellulose is prepared from cellulose, the main polysaccharide and constituent of wood and all plant structures. Commercially prepared from wood and chemically modified.
more_info.characteristics: br/>Many different uses, mainly as thickening agent, but also as filler, dietary fibre, anti clumping agent and emulsfier. Similar as cellulose, but very soluble in water.
more_info.side_effects:
/strong>
Carboxymethyl cellulose is very soluble, and can be fermented in the large intestine. Large concentrations can cause intestinal problems, such as bloating, constipation and diarrhoea.
more_info.dietary_restrictions:
/strong>
E466 can be consumed by all religious groups, vegans and vegetarians.

more_info.origin:
/strong>
Salts of natural fatty acids, mainly from plant origin, but also fats of animal origin may be used. The acids are a mixture of stearic-, oleic-, palmitic- and myristinic acid.
more_info.side_effects:
/strong>
None known. The body metabolises the products as any other fat.
more_info.dietary_restrictions:
/strong>
Although mainly vegetable oils are used, the use of animal fat (incl. pork) can not be excluded. Several groups, such as vegans, Muslims and Jews thus avoid these products. Only the producer can give detailed information on the origin of the fatty acids. Chemically the fatty acids from vegetable or animal origin are identical.

471.name: Mono- and di-glycerides of fatty acids

more_info.origin:
/strong>
Synthetic fats, produced from glycerol and natural fatty acids, mainly from plant origin, but also fats of animal origin may be used. The product generally is a mixture of different products, with a composition similar to partially digested natural fat.
more_info.side_effects:
/strong>
None known. The body metabolises the products as any other fat. The individual components are also produced normally in the body when digesting normal fat.
more_info.dietary_restrictions:
/strong>
Although mainly vegetable oils are used, the use of animal fat (incl. pork) can not be excluded. Several groups, such as vegans, Muslims and Jews thus avoid these products. Only the producer can give detailed information on the origin of the fatty acids. Chemically the fatty acids from vegetable or animal origin are identical.

more_info.origin:
/strong>
Esters of synthetic fats, produced from glycerol, natural fatty acids and another organic acid (acetic, lactic, tartaric, citric). The fatty acids are mainly from plant origin, but also fats of animal origin may be used. The product generally is a mixture of different components, with a composition similar to partially digested natural fat esterified with other natural acids..
more_info.daily_intake: br/>None determined except for 30 mg/kg bodyweight of tartaric acid for E472d-f.
more_info.side_effects:
/strong>
None known. The products are first digested to the individual acids and the fats. The body metabolises all components identical to the normal acids and natural fat. The individual components of the mono- and diglycerides are also produced normally in the body when digesting normal fat.
more_info.dietary_restrictions:
/strong>
Although mainly vegetable oils are used, the use of animal fat (incl. pork) can not be excluded. Several groups, such as vegans, Muslims and Jews thus avoid these products. Only the producer can give detailed information on the origin of the fatty acids. Chemically the fatty acids from vegetable or animal origin are identical.

more_info.origin:
/strong>
Esters of sugar and synthetic fats, produced from glycerol and natural fatty acids. The fatty acids are mainly from plant origin, but also fats of animal origin may be used. The product generally is a mixture of different components, with a composition similar to partially digested natural fat esterified with sugar.
more_info.side_effects:
/strong>
None known. The products are first digested to sugar and fats. The body metabolises all components identical to sugar and natural fat. The individual components of the mono- and diglycerides are also produced normally in the body when digesting normal fat.
more_info.dietary_restrictions:
/strong>
Although mainly vegetable oils are used, the use of animal fat (incl. pork) can not be excluded. Several groups, such as vegans, Muslims and Jews thus avoid these products. Only the producer can give detailed information on the origin of the fatty acids. Chemically the fatty acids from vegetable or animal origin are identical.

more_info.origin:
/strong>
Esters of sugar and fats, produced from sugar and natural fats. The fats are mainly from plant origin, but also fats of animal origin may be used. The product generally is a mixture of different components.
more_info.side_effects:
/strong>
None known. The products are first digested to sugar and fats. The body metabolises all components identical to sugar and natural fat.
more_info.dietary_restrictions:
/strong>
Although mainly vegetable oils are used, the use of animal fat (incl. pork) can not be excluded. Several groups, such as vegans, Muslims and Jews thus avoid these products. Only the producer can give detailed information on the origin of the fatty acids. Chemically the fatty acids from vegetable or animal origin are identical.

more_info.origin:
/strong>
Combination of polyglycerol and natural fats. Normal fat consists of glycerol and fatty acids, for these products additional glycerol is coupled to the normal glycerol. The fats are mainly from plant origin, but also fats of animal origin may be used. The product generally is a mixture of different components.
more_info.side_effects:
/strong>
None known. The body metabolises all components identical to natural fat.
more_info.dietary_restrictions:
/strong>
Although mainly vegetable oils are used, the use of animal fat (incl. pork) can not be excluded. Several groups, such as vegans, Muslims and Jews thus avoid these products. Only the producer can give detailed information on the origin of the fatty acids. Chemically the fatty acids from vegetable or animal origin are identical.

more_info.origin:
/strong>
Combination of polyglycerol and castoroil (oil of the tree Ricinus sp. ). Normal fat consists of glycerol and fatty acids, for these products additional glycerol is coupled to the normal glycerol. The product generally is a mixture of different components.
more_info.side_effects:
/strong>
None known.
more_info.dietary_restrictions:
/strong>
E476 can be consumed by all religious groups, vegans and vegetarians.

more_info.origin:
/strong>
Combination of propanediol and natural fats. Normal fat consists of glycerol and fatty acids, for these products glycerol is replaced by propanediol. The fats are mainly from plant origin, but also fats of animal origin may be used. The product generally is a mixture of different components.
more_info.daily_intake: br/>Up to 25 mg/kg bodyweight for propyleneglycol
more_info.side_effects:
/strong>
Both components are normally present in the body and will be metabolised in the normal way. High concentrations of propyleneglycol can cause eczema in sensitive persons, but not normally from the use in foods.
more_info.dietary_restrictions:
/strong>
Although mainly vegetable oils are used, the use of animal fat (incl. pork) can not be excluded. Several groups, such as vegans, Muslims and Jews thus avoid these products. Only the producer can give detailed information on the origin of the fatty acids. Chemically the fatty acids from vegetable or animal origin are identical.

478.name: Mixture of glycerol- and propyleneglycol esters of lactic acid and fatty acids

more_info.origin:
/strong>
Combination of lactic acid, glycerol, propanediol and natural fats. Normal fat consists of glycerol and fatty acids, for these products glycerol is replaced by propanediol. The fats are mainly from plant origin, but also fats of animal origin may be used. The product generally is a mixture of different components.
more_info.daily_intake: br/>Up to 25 mg/kg bodyweight for propyleneglycol
more_info.side_effects:
/strong>
All components are normally present in the body and will be metabolised in the normal way. High concentrations of propyleneglycol can cause eczema in sensitive persons, but not normally from the use in foods.
more_info.dietary_restrictions:
/strong>
Although mainly vegetable oils are used, the use of animal fat (incl. pork) can not be excluded. Several groups, such as vegans, Muslims and Jews thus avoid these products. Only the producer can give detailed information on the origin of the fatty acids. Chemically the fatty acids from vegetable or animal origin are identical.

more_info.origin:
/strong>
Produced by heating soy-oil in the presence of free fatty acids. The fatty acids are mainly from plant origin, but also fats of animal origin may be used. The product generally is a mixture of different components.
more_info.side_effects:
/strong>
The product is a normal fat and will be metabolised in the normal way.
more_info.dietary_restrictions:
/strong>
Although mainly vegetable oils are used, the use of animal fat (incl. pork) can not be excluded. Several groups, such as vegans, Muslims and Jews thus avoid these products. Only the producer can give detailed information on the origin of the fatty acids. Chemically the fatty acids from vegetable or animal origin are identical.

more_info.origin:
/strong>
Produced by a reaction of octane with maleic acid anhydride, followed by a reaction with sodium bisulphite.
more_info.products: br/>Bakery products, but mainly used in pharmaceutical preparations
more_info.side_effects:
/strong>
The product acts as a laxative.
more_info.dietary_restrictions:
/strong>
None, 480 can be used by all religious groups, vegans and vegetarians.

more_info.origin:
/strong>
Combination of stearic acid and lactic acid, resulting in a mixture of several components. The origin of stearic acid can be or plant or animal fat, although in practice nearly always vegetable oil will be used.
more_info.side_effects:
/strong>
None, both lactic acid and stearic acid are normal products in human metabolism.
more_info.dietary_restrictions:
/strong>
Although mainly vegetable oils are used, the use of animal fat (incl. pork) can not be excluded. Several groups, such as vegans, Muslims and Jews thus avoid these products. Only the producer can give detailed information on the origin of the fatty acids. Chemically the fatty acids from vegetable or animal origin are identical.

more_info.origin:
/strong>
Combination of calcium, stearic acid and lactic acid, resulting in a mixture of several components. The origin of stearic acid can be or plant or animal fat, although in practice nearly always vegetable oil will be used.
more_info.side_effects:
/strong>
None, both calcium, lactic acid and stearic acid are normal products in human metabolism.
more_info.dietary_restrictions:
/strong>
Although mainly vegetable oils are used, the use of animal fat (incl. pork) can not be excluded. Several groups, such as vegans, Muslims and Jews thus avoid these products. Only the producer can give detailed information on the origin of the fatty acids. Chemically the fatty acids from vegetable or animal origin are identical.

more_info.origin:
/strong>
Combination of stearic acid and tartaric acid, resulting in a mixture of several components. The origin of stearic acid can be or plant or animal fat, although in practice nearly always vegetable oil will be used.
more_info.side_effects:
/strong>
None, both tartaric and stearic acid are normal products in human metabolism.
more_info.dietary_restrictions:
/strong>
Although mainly vegetable oils are used, the use of animal fat (incl. pork) can not be excluded. Several groups, such as vegans, Muslims and Jews thus avoid these products. Only the producer can give detailed information on the origin of the fatty acids. Chemically the fatty acids from vegetable or animal origin are identical.

more_info.origin:
/strong>
Combination of stearic acid and citric acid, resulting in a mixture of several components. The origin of stearic acid can be or plant or animal fat, although in practice nearly always vegetable oil will be used.

None, both citric and stearic acid are normal products in human metabolism.
more_info.dietary_restrictions:

Only the producer can give detailed information on the origin of the fatty acids. Chemically the fatty acids from vegetable or animal origin are identical.

more_info.origin: br/>Obtained from animal by-products, such as bones and hides. It can be produced from all species of animals.
more_info.side_effects:
/strong>
None known when used in foods
more_info.dietary_restrictions:
/strong>
441 can not be used by vegans and vegetarians. Use by religious groups, such as Muslims and Jews is restricted, due to the origin of the product. Unfortunately information on origin can only be obtained from the producer. Specific halal gelatin is made from cattle.

more_info.origin:
/strong>
Synthetic product prepared from propylene from oil.
more_info.side_effects:
/strong>
It is metabolised to acetic and pyruvic acids, both are normal constituents of the body. High concentrations cause eczema, but not when used in foods.
more_info.dietary_restrictions:
/strong>
490 can be used by all religious groups, vegans and vegetarians.

more_info.origin:
/strong>
Produced from sorbitol and stearic acid, a normal fatty acid from vegetable or animal origin.
more_info.side_effects:
/strong>
It is metabolised to sorbitol and stearic acid, both are metabolised without any side effects.

/strong>
